intro: Chesniella tribuloides, commonly known as the slender chesniella, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel species. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, rocky habitats at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
